definition: The Moment of Truth (TV show)/Truth or Dare (game)
pinyin: Zhen1 xin1 hua4 Da4 Mao4 xian3

sentences.english: I truly hope that Wayne Rooney remains a Manchester United player.
sentences.chinese: 我真心地希望路尼留在曼聯。

sentences.english: But we both took one true heart and two box of loquats.
sentences.chinese: 但我們還是帶上一顆真心，兩箱枇杷。

sentences.english: I sincerely hope we can go point to a small roundabout, like me.
sentences.chinese: 我真心的希望大家可以向我一樣少走點彎路。

sentences.english: This poem expressed the poet's affection in the cockles of the heart and the loyalism in the poem was sincere.
sentences.chinese: 該詩是詩人自鳴中懷之作，詩中所表忠義確係真心。

sentences.english: I hope that Viking, his publisher, responds to these allegations in some meaningful way.
sentences.chinese: 我真心希望出版這些作品的維京出版社能做點表示。

sentences.english: The ‘letter’ has been changed as it is no longer a people's heart and a simple love letter.
sentences.chinese: 大概信不再言心，不再是表白真心的情書了才改的。

sentences.english: Here is a man truly dedicated to improving the lot of his fellow Ecuadorians.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個真心致力於改善民衆生活的人。

sentences.english: You can have for the asking all the peace you want.
sentences.chinese: 你若真心想要平靜，自當有求必應。

sentences.english: True faith in God cannot be kept secret.
sentences.chinese: 真心信神是無法祕而不宣的。

sentences.english: Many sincere thanks to you, dear Min.
sentences.chinese: 真心地謝謝你，敏你在他鄉也好嗎？

sentences.english: He established his Buddhist theory on the basis of Chinsim Chiksol (straight talk on the true mind) theory.
sentences.chinese: 他以“真心”說爲基礎建立了自己的禪學思想理論。

sentences.english: You can forget the asseveration of past, but want to remember own of sincerely.
sentences.chinese: 你可以忘記以前的誓言，但要記住自己的真心。

sentences.english: Everyone is really welcoming of all like different cultures  and stuff, so it's really nice.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都真心地接受各種文化，感覺很好。

sentences.english: They all have in common, however, sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 不過，他們共同擁有的就是真心誠意。

sentences.english: Truly priceless treasures are made of love and cannot be purchased with money.
sentences.chinese: 真正的無價寶是出自真心，而非用錢能買到。

sentences.english: I want you to mean it.= I want you to say what you mean.

definition: to be totally devoted (to a person)
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])
heartbeat/heart rate/(fig.) emotionally affected/aroused (of desire, emotion, interest etc)
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
